com.carnivorous_exports.engine

Class Audio

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.carnivorous_exports.engine.Audio

  • public class Audio
extends java.lang.Object
    Only construct this class once (there is no way of getting around that, it is a part of openGL). To add files/play multiple songs use addFile(). Change the variable "audioNumber" for each different audio file. There is a limit of 1 million audio files (I think), but I would not recommend testing that.

    Audio in JOGL is a little sensitive and there is not much stupid-proofing done in this class yet. Most things in this class do not make sense with a Java context (because openGL is written in C) and you just have to take for granted that calls to openGL objects do weird things sometimes.

    Author:
    Nathaniel Schultz

    • Method Detail

      • newFile

        public void newFile(int audioNumber,
           java.lang.String filePath,
           boolean autoRepeat,
           float[] position,
           float volume,
           long length)
        Call this method to construct a new audio file.
        Parameters:
        audioNumber - this must be unique to each audio file
        filePath - the path to the audio file
        autoRepeat - true if the audio file repeats automatically
        position - the position of the audio source in 3D space
        volume - how loud the file plays: ranges from 0.0f (very quiet) to 1.0f (very loud)
        length - How long the file plays for. If you enter a length longer than the track itself, it will fill with no sound. If you enter a length shorter than the track, it will cut the track short.

      • startInit

        public static void startInit()
        This method is called only once. The openAL can only be initialized once per thread and that is why you only construct this audio class once.

        Beware, don't try to make a multithreaded audio system, it is overly complicated and will not work as well as a single thread because you can only hear audio from one thread at a time (as far as I know).

      • init

        public static void init(int audioNumber)
        This method is called by newFile(). Do not use this method to initiate a new audio file directly, call newFile() instead.
        Parameters:
        audioNumber - this must be unique to each audio file
        See Also:
        newFile(int, String, boolean, float[], float, long)

      • killALData

        static void killALData(int audioNumber)
        This should be called when the audio file is done being used. This must be called before you initialize another AL if you are so inclined to do so.
        Parameters:
        audioNumber - this must be unique to each audio file

      • stop

        public void stop(int audioNumber)
        Call this method to stop a specific audio file. This is different from pausing a file.
        Parameters:
        audioNumber - this must be unique to each audio file
        See Also:
        pause(int)
